intro: Eriospermum cervicorne, commonly known as the horned eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features distinctive, spiny bracts that resemble horns, giving it its common name. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Eriospermum cervicorne is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
